title: [Large-Scale] Workshop on Strategies to Overcome Resistance to Active Learning: For Pre-Service Language Teachers

context.prior_knowledge: Possession of basic educational methodologies and language teaching experience (grammar, vocabulary, reading comprehension instruction, etc.)
context.additional_context: Specific analysis of learner resistance (e.g., speaking avoidance, writing burden) occurring when applying activity-based language teaching methods in online environments and exploration of response strategies.

learning_goals: Learners can analyze at least three root causes of negative perceptions toward active language learning (e.g., grammar-centered education experiences, expression anxiety).
Learners can apply five classroom management strategies (e.g., vocabulary expansion activities, text-based discussion facilitation) to real language education cases to mitigate learner resistance.

Learners can develop and pilot a three-stage framework (preparation-execution-reflection) for designing language collaborative activities (e.g., role-playing, writing feedback) in online environments.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
